publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2438 Brian Adam: National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005â€”That the Parliament notes that National Science Week takes place between 11 and 20 March 2005; notes that this year is designated "Einstein Year" in celebration of the fact that, 100 years ago at the age of 26, Albert Einstein published important scientific papers on Brownian Motion, the Photoelectric Effect and Special Relativity; welcomes the opportunity National Science Week gives people throughout Scotland to celebrate the work of the young Einstein and other scientists, participate in science activities and experiments and engage in science discussions; congratulates the British Association for the Advancement of Science (the BA) for co-ordinating National Science Week which last year attracted hundreds of thousands of people across the UK, and encourages MSPs to visit the BA website (www.the-ba.net/nsw/) and join in activities in their constituency or region.

S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Mr David Davidson*, Rob Gibson*, Stewart Stevenson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Richard Lochhead*, Mike Pringle*, Alex Neil*, Ms Sandra White*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Michael Matheson*, Patrick Harvie*
S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Roseanna Cunningham*, Christine Grahame*
S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Eleanor Scott*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Linda Fabiani*, Fiona Hyslop*, Robert Brown*
S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Dr Elaine Murray*
S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Jim Mather*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Robin Harper*
S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Mr Jamie Stone*
S2M-2438 National Science Week - 11 to 20 March 2005 (lodged on 17 February 2005) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
